intro: Leucocoryne simulans, commonly known as the white-flowered grassleaf, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
